resources.string: Tour guide
Universal Studios Singapore®
Enter the thrilling world of movie magic as you Ride the Movies on roller coasters and other movie-themed attractions.
Get Directions
Universal Studios Singapore®
S.E.A. Aquarium™
Adventure Cove Waterpark™
Dolphin Island
The Maritime Experiential Museum
Trick Eye Museum
K-live Sentosa
Enter the thrilling world of movie magic as you Ride the Movies on roller coasters and other movie-themed attractions.
Explore the awe-inspiring universe of life in the ocean at S.E.A. Aquarium™, one of the world\'s largest aquarium.
Plunge into wet and wild fun at Adventure Cove Waterpark™, a tropical paradise with an escapade for everyone.
Dolphin Island offers a range of programmes that gives you the opportunity to interact with Indo-Pacific Bottlenose dolphins and to learn about them.
Experience Asia\'s rich maritime history, an interactive, multi-sensorial museum for the whole family.
Trick Eye Museum is finally here in Singapore. Get ready to let your imagination march into a miraculous dimension of original 3D artworks.
You can now meet K-Pop stars anytime you want! Experience the magic of K-Pop through this high-tech hologram comprising both real and virtual performances.
Beach Villas™
Crockfords Tower
Equarius Hotel™
Festive Hotel™
Genting Hotel Jurong
Hard Rock Hotel Singapore
Hotel Michael™
Ocean Suite
Treetop Loft™
Whether it\'s for a special holiday, a well-earned break or your honeymoon, Beach Villas™ is the ultimate idyllic destination.
The epitome of luxury, this all-suite only hotel combines discreet exclusivity and premium personalised service.
Located at the fringe of a tropical rainforest, we offer Equarius Hotel™ as the ideal getaway for nature lovers.
Vibrant and fun, Festive Hotel™ provides a lively island ambience that is perfect for family vacations.
The first hotel in Jurong Lake District brings you chic rooms and island-wide accessibility at sensible rates.
With its modern interiors, Hard Rock Hotel Singapore\'s contemporary vibe will inject a rock-and-roll edge to your holiday experience.
Stepping into a room at Hotel Michael™is like entering an art gallery with its mural-adorned walls and artistic furniture pieces.
Discreetly tucked away on one side of the world\’s largest aquarium, guests will be treated to five-star comfort and personalized butler service.
Tucked away in a canopy of native trees and perched 12 metres above ground, the Treetop Loft™ is the epitome of exclusivity and privacy.
Celebrity Chefs
Asian Cuisine
Western Cuisine
Halal Cusine
Bars & Lounges
Other Choices
Lavish your taste buds at some of the best restaurants in Singapore, helmed by famous celebrity chefs in the culinary world.
Satiate your craving for authentic local flavours, Malaysia\'s famous hawker fare, spicy Korean delights, or anything in between.
Take your pick from some of the best-loved Italian classics and American contemporary favourites.
Enjoy a fabulous feast at our certified Halal restaurants where food is prepared according to Islamic dietary laws.
Socialize and chill out with a specially concocted cocktail.
From light bites to hearty international buffet, you’ll find every reason to indulge at Resorts World Sentosa.
Brighter Stars and Smiles This Season

Mulan The Musical\n16 December 2016 – 5 February 2017

Christmas is in the air, and every corner of our Resort is imbued with festive cheer, from our attractions to our restaurants. Come with loved ones and join in the fun, the feasts and the festivities!
Adventure Cove Waterpark Adult One-Day Pass + 1 Free Can of Coke (min. spend S$15) at S$31\n\tRedemption locations: Blue Ice, Hot Dog or Riverside Snacks
S.E.A. Aquarium Adult One-Day Pass + 1 Free Can of Coke (min. spend S$10) at S$29\n\tRedemption locations: S.E.A.side Snacks or Ocean Bites
Enjoy 10% off Universal Studios Singapore Adult One-Day Pass at S$67 (Usual Price: S$74) when you pay by Mastercard.
Buy in pairs and receive a FREE Souvenir Bottle\n(worth S$25, excluding drink) when you pay by Mastercard.

If you thought Hua Mulan took her father’s place in the army out of filial piety, you’re in for a surprise. Based on the popular legend of Hua Mulan, this musical comedy from Taiwan promises hilarious twists and turns.
